title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd named Santiago travels in search of a worldly treasure, learning about destiny and dreams.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian tale of totalitarian surveillance and control in a society where independent thought is suppressed.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic novel about Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy navigating love, class, and social expectations.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of wealth, love, and illusion set in the Roaring Twenties, centering on the enigmatic Jay Gatsby.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A rebellious teenager, Holden Caulfield, narrates his journey through alienation and identity in New York City.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the series, where young wizard Harry Potter discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an epic quest to help dwarves reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl in Nazi Germany steals books and shares them, narrated by Death itself.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A boy survives a shipwreck in a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, exploring faith, survival, and storytelling.
